posts.post_content:
Nice card. Glad to see this back as well. Get an extra land for the turn, and thin your deck at the same time. I still like Cultivate better, but this one is 1 mana cheaper.
  
4.0/5

posts.post_content: I prefer this to [Sakura-Tribe Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sakura-Tribe Elder) because a red deck can't bolt it as soon as it hits the field. 4/5 for me.

Posted By: Totema (11/22/2011 10:08:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Totema  
  
"I prefer this to Sakura-Tribe Elder because a red deck can't bolt it as soon as it hits the field. 4/5 for me."  
  
If someone were to cast any direct damage spell on [Sakura-Tribe Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sakura-Tribe Elder), even if it's immediately after it enters the battle field, you can sacrifice the creature in response, before their spell resolves. You'd get your land and their spell would fizzle because there's no longer a legal target for it.
posts.html:
@ Totema

"I prefer this to Sakura-Tribe Elder because a red deck can't bolt it as soon as it hits the field. 4/5 for me."

If someone were to cast any direct damage spell on Sakura-Tribe Elder, even if it's immediately after it enters the battle field, you can sacrifice the creature in response, before their spell resolves. You'd get your land and their spell would fizzle because there's no longer a legal target for it.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: EvilCowKing (12/9/2011 4:52:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I prefer this to [Cultivate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cultivate), but just barely.  
In my opinion, the T3 move is one of the most important steps to sealing a victory.  
Being able to drop a [Thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrun) T3 rather than [Dungrove](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dungrove) has made all the difference, and I would sometimes need to dedicate at T3 to [Cultivate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cultivate) into the proper landbase, which is discouragingly disappointing.
posts.html:
I prefer this to Cultivate, but just barely.

Being able to drop a Thrun T3 rather than Dungrove has made all the difference, and I would sometimes need to dedicate at T3 to Cultivate into the proper landbase, which is discouragingly disappointing.

Posted By: jmon027 (9/20/2011 11:41:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @infernox10 That's why most good green decks run 1-drops like [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves), [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf), and [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), so you can play things like [Cultivate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cultivate) and [Dungrove Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dungrove Elder) on turn 2. I prefer cultivate, just for the larger deck-thinning, card advantage, and it's always nice to search for 2 lands. It keeps the tempo of the mana base very high.
posts.html:
@infernox10 That's why most good green decks run 1-drops like Llanowar Elves, Arbor Elf, and Birds of Paradise, so you can play things like Cultivate and Dungrove Elder on turn 2.
